originalText.text: They recrafted one of my favorite pairs of Allen Edmonds shoes, repaired another with a smaller issue, and repaired a tear in a leather jacket I've had for over a decade. Their service is excellent and they really know their leather! Only issue is that it's currently cash only, but there's an ATM within a short walk. Definitely taking my other shoe repair and touch up needs here in the future!

text.text: They recrafted one of my favorite pairs of Allen Edmonds shoes, repaired another with a smaller issue, and repaired a tear in a leather jacket I've had for over a decade. originalText.text: During my trip in business, suddenly the heel of my shoe got off. I know it can happen anytime. But when it really did, that was a big trouble. I knocked the door of Cesar's Shoe Repair to ask if they could do a quick fix on it. They answered 'of course' and in fact they did a great job in just less than 20 minutes or so. The result was perfect and I say it was very much more than I expected. The cost was also reasonable enough for the quality. I do not know if they are specially well skilled, or most shoe repairers are also good like them, but one thing I am sure is that they are well skilled shoe repairer and they can satisfy me very much. It will be very likely I will knock the door of them again whenever I need help from them!

originalText.text: Took a pair of leather ankle boots in to Cesar's shoe repair to have the heels rebuilt. Very reasonable price and they were ready two days later. I picked them up to find he also replaced the grips on the soles and oiled them really nicely. Really happy with the result, would recommend for all your boot repair needs.

originalText.text: Cesar‚Äôs Shoe Repair is a miracle worker! 10/10 recommend! I brought in five pairs of shoes to get repaired. One of the pairs of shoes, my beloved Gucci mules, were so damaged that I wasn‚Äôt even going to try to get them fixed (my dog chewed them up when she was a puppy, and there were chunks of leather missing from the heel and toe). To my surprise, Cesar‚Äôs Shoe Repair said that they could repair them to the best of their ability, and the results far exceeded my expectations! The mules look amazing - I‚Äôm shocked! The other four pairs of shoes also look fantastic üòç I‚Äôm 1000% bringing all of my shoes here in the future.

originalText.text: Job 1:  I had a pair of brown 1977 vintage Florsheim long wings and a pair of black handmade cowboy boots resoled.  The work was delivered on time and was excellent in every way.  Job 2:  I was so pleased I took a pair of 1964 black Florsheim long wings for resoling.  Edward also rewelted the pair at no extra cost.  In addition, I took a pair of vintage Lucchese San Antonio cowboy boots for resoling.  Edward replaced the heel stacks at no extra cost.  Excellent work and terrific service.  Job 3: Edward recrafted a pair of tan Cowtown sharkskin cowboy boots and a pair of black cherry Lucchese Ropers.  As with the other jobs, the work was first rate and reasonably priced.  Cesar's is my preferred cobbler in NYC.  I have since sent two pairs of Tony Lama Black Label cowboy boots to Edward at Cesar's for his JR recrafting package and with the others before them, they came out looking beautiful.  Great job!
